meanings.definition: Spread out over a wide area
meanings.sent1: The stars in the night sky looked delocalized, twinkling in every direction.
meanings.sent2: The city's lights created a delocalized glow that could be seen from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The spilled glitter on the floor seemed to have a delocalized party of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, creating a delocalized sense of joy.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons floated in a delocalized pattern, adding a festive touch to the event.

meanings.definition: Not confined to a particular location
meanings.sent1: The idea of love is delocalized, it can be felt anywhere in the world.
meanings.sent2: Technology has made communication delocalized, allowing us to connect globally.
meanings.sent3: The scent of freshly baked cookies delocalized throughout the house, tempting everyone.
meanings.sent4: His music had a delocalized appeal, resonating with listeners from different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The concept of freedom is delocalized, transcending borders and boundaries.

meanings.sent1: The seeds from the dandelion were delocalized by the wind, spreading across the field.
meanings.sent2: The rumors about the new movie were delocalized, reaching every corner of the town.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter was delocalized in the playground, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The scent of fresh flowers delocalized through the garden, perfuming the air.
meanings.sent5: The news of the upcoming sale was delocalized, attracting shoppers from neighboring towns.
